trans-unit.source: Provides data for events that can be handled completely in an event handler.
Typically, the value of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs.Handled%2A> property is set in an event handler to indicate that the system should perform no further processing.

This class is a base class for types such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellPaintingEventArgs>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowPrePaintEventArgs>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeightInfoPushedEventArgs>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs> classes.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs"></xref> class with a default <xref href="System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs.Handled"></xref> property value of `false`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified default value for the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs.Handled"></xref> property.
The default value for the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs.Handled"></xref> property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the event handler has completely handled the event or whether the system should continue its own processing.
`true` if the event has been completely handled; otherwise, `false`.
